title.value: Towards a General Recipe for Combinatorial Optimization with Multi-Filter GNNs
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning and throughout the paper.
title.quote: Towards a General Recipe for Combinatorial Optimization with Multi-Filter GNNs

extractions.description: This paper introduces GCON, a novel Graph Neural Network architecture with a complex filter bank and localized attention mechanisms to solve combinatorial optimization problems on graphs. The paper positions GCON against existing GNN-based CO solvers, demonstrating its effectiveness in unsupervised settings across maximum cut, minimum dominating set, and maximum clique problems.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and benchmarking with various datasets and models to evaluate the performance of the GCON architecture.
type.quote: We evaluate GCON on a variety of graph-CO problems on synthetic graph benchmarks, and demonstrate that our architecture is highly performant.

name.justification: The paper focuses on solving combinatorial optimization problems using GNNs, which is a specific application area within the broader field of optimization in computer science and mathematics.
name.quote: Here, we introduce GCON, a novel GNN architecture that leverages a complex filter bank and localized attention mechanisms to solve CO problems on graphs.

name.justification: The GCON model is a specific type of graph neural network designed to handle combinatorial optimization problems.
name.quote: Recent years have seen the rapid development of neural networks for graph-structured data.

name.justification: The paper leverages concepts from graph signal processing, such as low-pass filtering, to design GCON's architecture.
name.quote: That can be interpreted, from the perspective of graph signal processing (GSP), as low-pass filtering.

name.justification: GCON is introduced as the novel model proposed by the authors to address combinatorial optimization problems using GNNs.
name.quote: To address these challenges, we propose the Graph Combinatorial Optimization Network (GCON), a novel GNN.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces GCON as a novel GNN architecture.
is_contributed.quote: We propose the Graph Combinatorial Optimization Network (GCON), a novel GNN.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the execution of GCON in experiments on various datasets, highlighting its performance against other models.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate GCON on a variety of graph-CO problems on synthetic graph benchmarks, and demonstrate that our architecture is highly performant.

is_compared.justification: GCON is compared against various competing methods, such as heuristics, commercial solvers, and other GNN-based models.
is_compared.quote: We compare GCON to various competing methods, such as heuristics, commercial solvers, other specialized GNN-based approaches.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no previous reference paper for GCON as it is introduced in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We develop GCON, a novel GNN architecture.

name.justification: Cora is mentioned as a homophilic social network dataset used for node classification.
name.quote: While this is a useful heuristic on homophilic social networks such as the ubiquitous Cora, CiteSeer, and PubMed datasets [7].

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Gaussian Embedding of Graphs: Unsupervised Inductive Learning via Ranking
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Cora dataset is referenced from a paper on deep Gaussian embedding of graphs.
referenced_paper_title.quote: on homophilic social networks such as the ubiquitous Cora, CiteSeer, and PubMed datasets [7].

name.justification: CiteSeer is mentioned alongside Cora as another dataset used for node classification.
name.quote: While this is a useful heuristic on homophilic social networks such as the ubiquitous Cora, CiteSeer, and PubMed datasets [7].

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Gaussian Embedding of Graphs: Unsupervised Inductive Learning via Ranking
referenced_paper_title.justification: CiteSeer is referenced from the same paper as Cora regarding deep Gaussian embedding.
referenced_paper_title.quote: on homophilic social networks such as the ubiquitous Cora, CiteSeer, and PubMed datasets [7].

name.justification: PubMed is part of the reference to common datasets for GNN benchmarking, often used for node classification.
name.quote: While this is a useful heuristic on homophilic social networks such as the ubiquitous Cora, CiteSeer, and PubMed datasets [7].

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Gaussian Embedding of Graphs: Unsupervised Inductive Learning via Ranking

name.justification: PyTorch Geometric is mentioned in the experimental setup as part of the framework used for building the models in the study.
name.quote: Our experimental framework is built on PyTorch Geometric and GraphGym.

referenced_paper_title.value: Fast Graph Representation Learning with PyTorch Geometric
referenced_paper_title.justification: This library is commonly referenced for fast graph representation learning.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our experimental framework is built on PyTorch Geometric and GraphGym.
